labels.analysis:
The MCP Server described is a Shell Server that allows execution of whitelisted shell commands in a secure manner.
    It provides basic file operations, text processing, and directory navigation capabilities
    through allowed commands like find, cat, ls, wc, pwd, grep, and touch.
    This server is focused on providing a controlled environment for executing fundamental
    command-line operations rather than advanced system management or processing.
labels.reasoning:
The primary functionality aligns with file operations and basic system interactions,
    making "Operating System" the most appropriate primary label.
    "File Management" is a relevant secondary label since many of the allowed commands are
    file-related. The tool set is somewhat limited but could also relate to basic
    data processing through text manipulation commands.

tools.name: shell_execute

command.description: Command and its arguments as array

stdin.description: Input to be passed to the command via stdin

directory.description: Working directory where the command will be executed

server_info_crawled.name: Shell Server
server_info_crawled.author: mcp-shell-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Execute whitelisted shell commands securely via MCP.

tools.name: shell_execute
tools.description:
Execute a shell command
Allowed commands: find, cat, ls, wc, pwd, grep, touch

command.description: Command and its arguments as array

stdin.description: Input to be passed to the command via stdin

directory.description: Working directory where the command will be executed

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

config = {
  "allowCommands": "ls,cat,pwd,grep,wc,touch,find"
}
# Encode config in base64
config_b64 = base64.b64encode(json.dumps(config).encode()).decode()
smithery_api_key = ""

# Create server URL
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/mcp-shell-server/mcp?config={config_b64}&api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
